refnamediv.refpurpose: Configuration file for the Davit Affiliate Management System

refsynopsisdiv.para: The /etc/davit.conf file is the primary configuration file for the Davit Affiliate Menagement System.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The file format consists of sections, each of which contain configuration information in the form of keyword/value pairs. Each section begins with with the name of the section in [] brackets, followed by zero or more keyword/value pairs, with the keyword and value separated by an = sign. Lines starting with ; are ignored, as are blank lines.
refsect1.literallayout: [Section1] ; This is a comment. Keyword1=value1 Keyword2=value2 Keyword3=value3

refsect1.title: Sections/Keywords
refsect1.para: Following are the sections and keywords for davit.conf

listitem.para: This section contains access credentials and attributes for the MySQL/MariaDB RDBMS server.
The hostname or IP address of the database server. Default value is localhost.
The user name to use when connecting to the database server. This parameter has no default value.
The password to use when connecting to the database server. This parameter has no default value.
The name of the database to use when connecting to the database server. Default value is Davit.

The name of the Qt SQL driver plug-in to use when connecting to the database server. Consult the Qt documentation for the list of available values. Default value is QMYSQL. It should seldom be necessary to change this.
This section contains hints concerning the fonts to be used when drawing the various widgets in Davit. The font engine uses these values to calculate various related fonts.
The name of the font family to be used for dialogs. Default value is System.
The height, in pixels, of the font used for most pushbuttons. Default value is 12.
The height, in pixels, of the font used for most labels. Default value is 11.
The height, in pixels, of the font used for most data elements. Default value is 11.

This section contains pointers to zero or more Wireguard VPN configurations, defining VPN tunnels to be brought up automatically when the davit(1) application is started and shutdown at its termination.
The full path to a Wireguard configuration to be brought up when davit(1) is started.
